Dear Sheffield City Council,
1.	How many public children’s playgrounds were managed and maintained by you at the start of each of the last five financial years (a) 1.4.19, (b) 1.4.20, (c) 1.4.21, (d) 1.4.22 and (e) 1.4.23?
2.	What was your spend in each of the last five financial years (18/19) (19/20) (20/21) (21/22) and (22/23) on the maintenance, or improvement or development of children’s playgrounds in your local authority area? If possible please break this figure down into (i) revenue spend and (ii) capital expenditure.
3.	How many accidents have been reported to you where people have been injured in public children’s playgrounds for which you have responsibility in each of the last five financial years (18/19) (19/20) (20/21) (21/22) and (22/23)?
4.	In relation to accidents in the last financial year (22/23) please provide me with a summary of how each accident took place and the extent of the injury.
5.	For each of the last five financial years (18/19) (19/20) (20/21) (21/22) and (22/23) please state how much compensation has been paid to people who were injured in accidents that took place in public children’s playgrounds for which you have responsibility? NOTE: I am interested in when the compensation was paid not when the accident took place or when the claim was lodged.
Yours faithfully,
Matthew Davis

Dear Matthew Davis,
Thank you for your request for information relating to playgrounds which
we received on 12/01/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 09/02/2024. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Matthew Davis,
Thank you for your request for information relating to playgrounds which
we received on 12/01/2024.
1. How many public children’s playgrounds were managed and maintained by
you at the start of each of the last five financial years (a) 1.4.19, (b)
1.4.20, (c) 1.4.21, (d) 1.4.22 and (e) 1.4.23?
The figures below include some sites with standalone multi-use games
areas, wheels tracks and climbing boulders (as they are considered as part
of outdoor play and are inspected and maintained by our playgrounds team).
(a) 1.4.19      150
(b) 1.4.20      151
(c) 1.4.21      152
(d) 1.4.22      153
(e) 1.4.23      155
2. What was your spend in each of the last five financial years (18/19)
(19/20) (20/21) (21/22) and (22/23) on the maintenance, or improvement or
development of children’s playgrounds in your local authority area? If
possible please break this figure down into (i) revenue spend and (ii)
capital expenditure.
Capital expenditure/investment on outdoor play facilities including wheels
tracks is set out below. There will be elements of this expenditure which
is for park
infrastructure that will form part of the investment:
18/19 £778,293
19/20 £678,720
20/21 £476,129
21/22 £853,007
22/23 £632,659
Revenue expenditure for the maintenance and management of playgrounds:
2018-19 2019-20 2020-21 2021-22 2022-23
All figures in £ Actuals Actuals Actuals Actuals Actuals
Grand Total SCC Revenue Spend 407,986 387,737 381,530 397,898 391,277
3. How many accidents have been reported to you where people have been
injured in public children’s playgrounds for which you have responsibility
in each of the last five financial years (18/19) (19/20) (20/21) (21/22)
and (22/23)?
With regards to employees there has been zero accidents / incidents in the
above time frame in childrens playgrounds.  We didn’t start to collect
data until 2022 that related to third parties. (e.g member of public etc).
We hold separate data for Schools from September 2021, there was 1
incident in 2021 and 2 in 22/23.
4. In relation to accidents in the last financial year (22/23) please
provide me with a summary of how each accident took place and the extent
of the injury.
All 3 incidents involved children visiting park as part of an off-site
visit, all 3 were slips, trips and falls resulting in very minor injuries.
5. For each of the last five financial years (18/19) (19/20) (20/21)
(21/22) and (22/23) please state how much compensation has been paid to
people who were injured in accidents that took place in public children’s
playgrounds for which you have responsibility? NOTE: I am interested in
when the compensation was paid not when the accident took place or when
the claim was lodged.
We can confirm that the Council have made no compensation payments for the
financial years commencing 2018/19 – 2022/23 as a result of injuries that
took place in public childrens’ playgrounds for which the Council are
responsible for.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
